title: Champion Mastery Equation

embed.description: The easy way to save screenshots, GIFs, and websites. Make everyone happy by sharing smarter, faster, and with your point crystal clear.

body:
Is there a discrete formula that decides your rank that you receive at the end of each game or is there some sort of probability involved because I can't seem to figure it out. I only received an A+ for that game and it was really disappointing - especially given the fact that our Soraka got an S even though I had a higher kill participation than her. 

http://gifrific.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/Confused-Jacksonville-Jaguars-fan-in-stands.gif

replies.body:
The biggest misconception about champion mastery is that you just need to do certain things or get a certain amount of kills/etc to get an S. Mastery works slightly different than that however. Essentially, your mastery score is decided by looking at how you did with that champion in the role you played them as, and compares that to others who were playing the same champion in the same role. 

For instance, if you play Annie Mid you will be scored slightly differently than if you were playing Annie Support because you would play her quite differently in those two lanes.

>Essentially, your mastery score is decided by looking at how you did with that champion in the role you played them as, and compares that to others who were playing the same champion in the same role. 

I'm aware of this already but I guess it must be a pretty rigidly tuned algorithm. Either that, or I'm just bad at Kled.

The most important thing to take away from how Mastery Scores are calculated is this: you're being compared to how well others are doing using that champ in that role. 

It doesn't necessarily mean you're doing bad, but maybe just not getting as much vision score that others get or your kills/assists vs deaths. A lot of people think the most important stat is your KDA is a little skewed, but theres a lot more that goes into it than just that.

That makes sense. I rarely ever place control wards down because I rely on my scrying orb to do the work. I guess I'll be a better team player next time.
